page.title: 13TRANSPORT SURVEY
page.content: OF THE SURVEYS FROM NORTH GLENROTHES THE FOLLOWING RESULTS WERE 66% OF THOSE INTERVIEWED FELT THAT THERE WAS AN ADEQUATE BUS SERVICE.THE REMAINING 34% FELT THAT THE BUS SERVICE WAS POOR WITH INADEQUATE BUS SHELTERS BEING A COMMON COMPLAINT.THE METHODS OF TRANSPORT IN THIS AREA ARE LIMITED TO WALKING,BUS AND CAR.OF THESE, TRAVELLING BY BUS OR CAR LEAD THE POLL WITH 40% OF THE RESULT EACH.THE REMAINING 20% WALK.THE BUS WAS MORE POPULAR FOR THOSE TRAVELLING OUTSIDE THE TOWN. THE CHANGES WHICH HAVE TAKEN PLACE IN TRANSPORT OVER THE YEARS ARE HIGHLIGHTED IN OUR RESULTS WITH MORE THAN HALF OF THOSE INTERVIEWED SAYING THAT TRANSPORT HAD GREATLY IMPROVED. OF THOSE INTERVIEWED 60% FELT THAT THE BUS CHARGES WERE TOO EXPENSIVE WHILE 40% FELT THAT IT WAS GOOD VALUE
